mode: Internet-Based Test (IBT) for candidates outside India
eligibility: Candidates must have completed a bachelorâ€™s degree in any discipline from a recognized university. Final year students are also eligible to apply. There is no age limit.
examFrequency: Once a year (with up to three attempts within a 70-day test window)

faqs.question: How many times can a candidate attempt NMAT in a year?
faqs.answer: A candidate can attempt NMAT up to three times in a year (one attempt and two retakes) within the test window, with a minimum 15-day gap between attempts.
